intro: Apodolirion lanceolatum, commonly known as the lanceleaf larkspur, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to the western United States. It belongs to the Ranunculaceae family and is characterized by its tall, spindly stems and clusters of blue to purple flowers. The plant has lance-shaped leaves that are often covered in fine hairs, contributing to its distinctive appearance. It thrives in rocky or gravelly soils and is typically found in open, sunny habitats. Due to its ornamental value and ecological importance, it is sometimes cultivated in gardens.
